long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
The Mzn URL Group Manager is a Chrome extension designed to help users organize, manage, and quickly access groups of URLs. Whether you're a developer, researcher, or simply someone who works with multiple web pages, this extension allows you to categorize and manage your URLs efficiently.

Features:

Customizable URL Groups:
Create, rename, and delete groups of URLs as needed. Each group can contain a list of URLs related to a specific task or project.

Editable URL Lists:
Within each group, you can add, remove, or modify URLs. This makes it easy to keep your workspaces organized and up to date.

Automatic URL Opening:
Open all URLs in a selected group with a single click. URLs can be opened in new tabs, either in the foreground or background, depending on your preference.
Background and Foreground Tabs:

Backup and Restore:
Backup all your URL groups to a JSON file with one click. This allows you to easily transfer your settings to another device or restore them if needed. You can also restore your groups from a previously saved JSON file.

User-Friendly Interface:
The interface is simple and intuitive, making it easy to manage large numbers of URLs without hassle.

How It Works:

Adding Groups: Click "Add Group" to create a new URL group. Each group is editable, allowing you to rename it or delete it entirely.


Opening Groups: Click "Open All URLs" to launch all URLs in the selected group.

Backup/Restore: Use the "Backup All Groups" button to save your URL groups to a JSON file. The "Restore from Backup" button allows you to load a saved JSON file, restoring your previous URL groups.

Ideal Use Cases:

Developers: Group URLs related to different projects or environments.
Researchers: Save links to articles, papers, or resources in specific topic groups.
Students: Organize study materials, online courses, or research resources.

Get Started:
Download the Mzn URL Group Manager today and streamline your web browsing experience!
